xxl.core.relational.query.expressions
Class Operations

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.relational.query.expressions.Operations

public class Operations
extends Object

This class provides static methods for creating ready to use instances of an operation node in a directed acyclic graph. Beside these methods, it contains constants for identifying local metadata fragments inside an expression node's global metadata, methods for accessing them and local metadata factories for updating them.

See Also:
Node

Nested Class Summary
static class Operations.Type
          An enumeration providing the local metadata fragments used in an operation's global metadata for identifing the operation's type.

Method Detail

newOperation

public static final Node newOperation(Operations.Type type,
                                      int numberOfSubexpressions,
                                      Iterator<Node> subexpressions)
Creates a new operation of the given type that accepts the specified number of subexpressions and subsumes the subexpressions contained by the specified iteration.

Parameters:
type - the type of the expression node that should be returned.
numberOfSubexpressions - the number of subexpressions the returned expression node should be able to accept.
subexpressions - an iteration over the expression nodes that should be subsumed by the returned expression node.
Returns:
a new operation of the given type that accepts the specified number of subexpressions and subsumes the subexpressions contained by the specified iteration.

newOperation

public static final Node newOperation(Operations.Type type,
                                      int numberOfSubexpressions,
                                      Node... subexpressions)
Creates a new operation of the given type that accepts the specified number of subexpressions and subsumes the given subexpressions.

Parameters:
type - the type of the expression node that should be returned.
numberOfSubexpressions - the number of subexpressions the returned expression node should be able to accept.
subexpressions - the expression nodes that should be subsumed by the returned expression node.
Returns:
a new operation of the given type that accepts the specified number of subexpressions and subsumes the given subexpressions.
